message: The KTH Study Trip, or Studs, is an annual project at the Computer Science Program at the Royal Institute of Technology. The project aims to create a platform for interaction betwen soon-to-be examined students and relevant companies. For the students the project is also a 15 credit course that is examined by a report that summarizes the project as a whole. The project ends with a trip that gives the members opportunities for professional as well as cultural exchange.

Studs is an annual non-profit project at KTH, driven by students. The project consists of 30 selected engineering students enrolled in a master’s program related to computer science. By organizing events together with companies, we create a platform to give students and their potential future employers focused time together.

Throughout the year, the Studs members will visit various companies through events, usually arranged at their offices. The students take this opportunity to gain deeper insight into life at the company and its operations. Studs helps these companies tailor the events to their specific needs, guaranteeing that each event is as unique as the company hosting it.

The project ends with a trip to the United States, in order to give the project members an opportunity for cultural and professional exchange. The US has a unique position in the world of technology with cities such as San Francisco, New York, and Seattle that generate continuous innovation and growth for startups and established players alike.
If you're interested in having an event with us, or you're curious and want to know more – contact Cristian
